As the biometric information registered on your phone has changed,
authentication factor has changed to PIN.

To use the biometric authentication please
re-register biometric information in Settings.

PIN failed 3 times.\nIf it fails more than 5 times, the app will reset.

• Please enter User Key on the account registration page of the admin portal.

• Click [Scan QR code] at the bottom to scan the QR code from the admin portal

• If you cannot use the camera, please proceed with [Enter manually].
Please scan the\nQR code displayed on the admin portal.
• Please enter the Pairing Key at the bottom of the QR code on the admin portal.\n• Press [Next] at the bottom.
Use letters/numbers/symbols, max length is 20 characters
This account name has already been registered.
• The account name can be changed later in settings.\n• Click [Finish] at the bottom.
OTAC Auth Application Terms and Conditions

These terms and conditions regulate the utilization of the \'OTAC auth app\' (hereinafter referred to as the \'App\'), a public application provided by \'swIDch Ltd.\' (hereinafter referred to as the \'Company\'), designed for employing the authentication solution extended by the Company. The primary objective is to establish comprehensive guidelines for all pertinent matters.

Within the confines of these Terms and Conditions, the following definitions apply:
1. 'OTAC auth app': Refers to an application installed on the user's smartphone, generating a one-time authentication code (Dynamic One-Time Authentication Code) for user authentication.
2. 'User': An individual authorized by a customer who has installed the authentication solution provided by the 'Company' to access the customer’s facilities or systems through user authentication.
3. 'User authentication': The process by which a user obtains permission to access a facility or system through the app installed on their mobile phone.
4. 'Authentication solution': Pertains to the installation and implementation of the 'Company's' OTAC authentication system in the customer's equipment or system. The process involves registering and managing users who can access the equipment or system directly on the management page (web) or the relevant equipment. The primary purpose of this service is to control access.
5. 'Administrator Page': This is a web service provided by the 'Company' for customers who have installed and implemented the 'Company's' authentication solution. The service facilitates the management of users authorized to access the customer's facilities or systems through the user authentication process.
Article 3: Contents of App Services, Eligibility, and Supported Platforms

1. This service generates a continuously changing one-time authentication code (Dynamic One-Time Authentication Code) via the 'app' to oversee users with access to the customer’s facilities or systems.
2. By default, this service operates 24/7, 365 days a year, unless an exceptional issue arises due to a business or technical concern on the Company's part. It is extended at no cost to customers who have implemented the Company's authentication solution in accordance with the contract terms.
3. Tailored for users who have implemented the 'Company’s' authentication solution and have received authorization for access to the customer’s facilities and systems through the user authentication process.
4. Accessible through both Apple (iOS) and Android smartphones, the service's compatibility may be subject to the 'Company's' discretion, which could include limitations based on the smartphone's OS version.

1. Users are required to download the 'app' from platforms such as the App Store, Google Play, etc., install it on their smartphones, and proceed with the user registration process as outlined below:
2. Upon installation of the 'app,' users should carefully follow the provided instructions and execute the basic installation process to launch the application.
3. Upon launching the installed 'app,' a unique user number (User Key) is generated within the application for user authentication. Subsequently, users are required to input this user key into the administrator page (Web) or a facility necessitating access approval. Following this, a QR code is generated on the administrator page or facility. Users can opt to directly scan the QR code or alternatively register it by entering the user registration data received via email directly into the smartphone app.
4. Individual accounts corresponding to registered facilities and systems are visibly displayed within the smartphone 'app.'
5. User registration is conducted based on the authentication type integrated into the customer's equipment (facility) and system, following these approaches:
A. Authentication through server: Completed with a one-time registration.
B. Certification through individual equipment (facility): Registration is performed individually by completing the equipment registration process.
6. In cases where users arbitrarily delete access rights (account) to any facility or system registered on the smartphone, the restoration of access rights requires the re-execution of the user registration process for the pertinent facility or system.

1. Following user registration as outlined in Article 4, users activate the 'App' when gaining access to the facility or system. They generate a continually changing one-time authentication code (Dynamic One-Time Authentication Code) and employ it to authorize entry into the facility or system.
2. If the user fails to input the generated authentication code into the facility or system within the specified time set by the customer, the authentication code's validity will expire. In such cases, users must input the newly generated authentication code to proceed with the authentication process.
3. Users are responsible for verifying all conditions, including communication status, and must take necessary measures to ensure the 'App' functions normally.
4. Users can operate the 'app' on their smartphones, utilizing either the PIN, biometric information, or both, as registered during the 'app' installation. Settings adjustments are left to the discretion of the user.
Article 6: Change and Suspension of App Service

1. The 'Company' reserves the right to modify all or part of the service to enhance its functionality. In such instances, the 'Company' communicates these changes through the 'App.'
2. The 'Company' retains the authority to limit or suspend all or part of the service under the following circumstances:
A. Termination of the contract with the customer or when service upgrades and maintenance are deemed necessary.
B. Unavailability of the service due to force majeure, such as a natural disaster or national emergency.
C. Inability to maintain the service due to various circumstances within the control of the 'Company.'
3. In the event of service discontinuation as per Paragraph 2, the 'Company' shall make an announcement as specified in Paragraph 1 or directly notify the customer. However, this provision does not apply if service interruption occurs due to reasons beyond the control of the 'Company,' where advance notice is not feasible.

1. Personal information protected under the law, particularly information necessary for user authentication, is managed directly by the customer who has implemented the authentication solution. The 'Company' does not collect or store any personal information through this public 'App' service.
2. Users of the 'App' are responsible for the secure management of their personal information, including but not limited to PIN and biometric data. The 'Company' emphasizes the following precautions:
A. Users should refrain from sharing their PIN or biometric data with others to prevent unauthorized access.
B. It is the user's responsibility to ensure the security of their smartphone, including protection against unauthorized access, installing security updates, and using reliable security software.
C. Users should exercise caution and avoid downloading malicious software or apps that may compromise the security of their personal information.
D. In the event of a lost or stolen smartphone, users must promptly report and take necessary actions.
3. The 'Company' disclaims responsibility for any unauthorized access or security breaches resulting from the user's failure to adhere to the precautions outlined in this article.

1. Beyond the scope of this public \'App\' service, the \'Company\' disclaims responsibility for any damages resulting from errors in the system provided for user authentication. The said system is constructed, installed, and managed by the customer.\n2. This service is extended exclusively to customers who have installed and implemented the \'Company’s\' authentication solution. The \'Company\' holds no responsibility for damages arising from the arbitrary use of the service by third parties or customers.
Article 9: Effectiveness of Terms and Conditions

These Terms and Conditions come into effect when the user installs the \'App\' provided by the \'Company\' and completes user registration as outlined in Article 4. This process should align with the procedures established by the individual customer who introduced the authentication solution.
In the event of a dispute concerning the services specified in these Terms and Conditions, the competent court shall abide by the laws and regulations of the United Kingdom.
These terms and conditions take effect from January 1, 2024.
